skill.name: meeting-insights-analyzer
skill.description: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, and actionable feedback. Identifies when you avoid conflict, use filler words, dominate conversations, or miss opportunities to listen. Perfect for professionals seeking to improve their communication and leadership skills.
skill.summary: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, ...
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file access, or command execution capabilities detected. This is a benign skill that guides Claude on how to analyze meeting transcript text.

content.value_statement: Understanding your communication habits helps you become a more effective leader and team member. This skill identifies patterns like conflict avoidance, filler words, and speaking ratios across all your meeting transcripts.
actual_capabilities: Identify conflict avoidance patterns with specific transcript examples
Calculate speaking ratios and turn-taking statistics
Detect filler words and hedging language usage
Evaluate active listening indicators and questioning skills
Track communication trends over time across multiple meetings
Provide actionable feedback with better communication alternatives
limitations: Requires meeting transcripts to already exist in a local folder
Cannot analyze video or audio directly - only text transcripts
Quality of insights depends on transcript accuracy and speaker labels
Does not integrate with meeting platforms for live analysis

use_cases.title: Leadership communication style
use_cases.description: Understand how you facilitate meetings and whether you include all team voices in discussions.

use_cases.title: Customer call patterns
use_cases.description: Review sales calls to identify moments of uncertainty, hedging, or missed closing opportunities.

use_cases.title: One-on-one effectiveness
use_cases.description: Analyze how you deliver feedback and whether you address difficult topics directly.

prompt_templates.title: Conflict Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all transcripts in this folder and tell me when I avoided giving direct feedback or addressed tensions indirectly.

prompt_templates.title: Speaking Balance
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at my meetings and calculate my speaking ratio compared to others. Show me specific examples of when I talked too much.

prompt_templates.title: Filler Word Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Track my use of filler words like um, uh, like, you know, and actually. Show me where they appeared most frequently.

prompt_templates.title: Progress Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my communication patterns between meetings from last month and this month. Show improvement areas and remaining habits to address.

output_examples.input: Analyze my meetings folder and tell me when I avoided conflict.
output: Found 8 instances across 4 meetings where you used indirect communication instead of addressing tensions directly.
Pattern 1: Hedging language - 'maybe we could consider', 'if that makes sense', 'whatever you think is best'
Example: 1:1 with Sarah on March 15th - Avoided directly addressing that her project was behind schedule
Recommendation: State the issue in the first sentence and ask specific questions instead of hinting

best_practices: Use consistent file naming like 'YYYY-MM-DD - Meeting Name.txt' for easy organization
Ask about one behavior at a time to get deeper, more actionable insights
Review patterns monthly to track improvement in specific communication areas
anti_patterns: Asking for analysis without first ensuring transcripts have speaker labels and timestamps
Trying to analyze too many meeting types at once and losing focus on specific goals
Ignoring the recommended alternatives provided in the feedback

faq.question: What transcript formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill reads .txt, .md, .vtt, .srt, and .docx files. Files should include speaker labels for best results.

faq.question: How many meetings can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: The skill can analyze any number of meetings. More meetings provide better trend data but may take longer to process.

faq.question: Does this send my meeting data anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens locally through Claude Code. Your meeting transcripts never leave your machine.

faq.question: What if my transcripts do not have speaker names?
faq.answer: The skill will still analyze content patterns but cannot attribute speaking ratios to specific participants.

faq.question: How is this different from other meeting tools?
faq.answer: Unlike AI meeting assistants that summarize meetings, this skill analyzes your personal communication patterns for growth.

faq.question: Can I use this for customer calls?
faq.answer: Yes. Export customer call transcripts and analyze them for sales patterns, objection handling, or support quality.
